wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Anderson (17 November 1855 – 5 January 1940) was a Scottish football player and businessman in Shanghai and London. He served two terms as the Chairman of the Shanghai Municipal Council.

response: Fred or Frederick Anderson may refer to:
* Frederick Anderson (footballer) (1855–1940), Scottish footballer (national team) and businessman (chairman of the Shanghai Municipal Council)

With Scottish international players Frederick Anderson, John McPherson, James J Lang, James Tassie Richmond in the forward line, David Wotherspoon in defence and Robert W Gardner as captain and goalkeeper, Clydesdale were at one time the only team to give Queen's Park a good game and were in 1874 the team that broke Queen's Park's immaculate goal concession record. Clydesdale were strong enough to trounce Notts County 6–0.
Forwards Frederick Anderson, William Gibb, James R. Wilson, James J. Lang, John McPherson, and J. Kennedy.

Fearon was elected to and became chairman of the Shanghai Municipal Council in January 1898 and served until August 1899 when he resigned.North China Herald, August 28, 1899, p430 and North China Herald, October 30, 1920, p326 He was replaced as Chairman by Frederick Anderson.North China Herald, August 28, 1899, p430
